required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Colonoscopy AI System for Colon Polyp Detection According to the Workload of Endoscopy Units
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Colonoscopy AI System for Colon Polyp Detection According to the Workload of Endoscopy Units: A Single-center Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: Computer-aided detection (CADe) systems have been actively researched for polyp detection in colonoscopy. We aim to identify the effect of CADe system according to the workload of endoscopy units

detailed_description.textblock:
Artificial intelligence technology based on deep learning is being applied in various medical fields, and research is being actively conducted to develop computer-aided detection (CADe) systems for colonoscopies to overcome the limitation of the variance of human skills. These well-trained CADe systems demonstrated high performance for neoplastic polyp detection and reported a 44% increase in adenoma detection rate (ADR) for endoscopists.
Operator fatigue may negatively influence ADR during a screening colonoscopy, and many studies reported a decrease in ADR according to the increase of working hours and procedure number. Accordingly, we sought to identify the effect of the colonoscopy CADe system according to working hours and procedure numbers in endoscopists with various levels. We hypothesized that the CADe system would be useful to prevent the decrease in ADR in case of a high endoscopy workload.

primary_outcome.description: proportion of colonoscopies with at least one adenoma detected overall and as detected by the physician.
proportion of colonoscopies with at least one sessile serrated lesion detected overall and as detected by the physician.

secondary_outcome.description: proportion of colonoscopies with at least one polyp detected overall and as detected by the physician.

arm_group.description: Endoscopists perform colonoscopy with CADe system
Endoscopists perform colonoscopy without CADe system

intervention.intervention_name: Assist by artificial intelligence system for colon polyp detection
intervention.description: Assist by artificial intelligence system for colon polyp detection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
patient for screening or surveillance colonoscopy patients agreed with participating in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
patients who do not agree with participating in the study patients with a history of colon resection patients with a history of inflammatory bowel resection patients with poor bowel preparation

facility.name: Healthcare System Gangnam Center, Seoul National University Hospital

Performance of artificial intelligence in colonoscopy for adenoma and polyp detection: a systematic review and meta-analysis. Gastrointest Endosc. 2021 Jan;93(1):77-85.e6. doi: 10.1016/j.gie.2020.06.059. Epub 2020 Jun 26. Review.
